---
title: Why this site?
---

At the CSSDay conference in Amsterdam this June (2023) speaker [Miriam Suzanne](https://front-end.social/@mia) talked about container queries and how they worked. She then got a question from the audience if she knew any sites that uses them. She had the greatest response, here paraphrased by [Una Kravets](https://twitter.com/@una):

<div class="twitter-tweet twitter-tweet-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 550px; width: 100%; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Tweet" src="https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=false&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideCard=false&amp;hideThread=false&amp;id=1667085883462303746&amp;lang=en&amp;origin=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8080%2F&amp;sessionId=7ac200b599482761115dc1fca29c4566ca96665c&amp;theme=light&amp;widgetsVersion=aaf4084522e3a%3A1674595607486&amp;width=550px" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 367px; height: 394px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;" data-tweet-id="1667085883462303746"></iframe></div>
<script async="" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>

So this is a site telling Miriam (and for those interested) about other sites that use container queries.
